events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on March 28th involving their vehicle at an intersection.
Claim was reviewed and categorised as an Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle in the collision.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's case for the reported car accident and to guide through the process.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and informed the customer of next steps.
Request sent to the claimant for police reports, vehicle damage photos, and repair estimates to proceed with investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents promptly including official police report and detailed repair estimates.
The claims team began investigating the circumstances surrounding the reported car accident to verify details.
Investigation confirmed claimant was not at fault and damages were consistent with reported collision circumstances.
The insurer proposed a settlement offer covering full vehicle repair costs and rental car reimbursement.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the fair settlement offer and timely communication from the insurance agent.
Formal approval provided for the settlement amount to be disbursed toward vehicle damages and associated expenses.
Payment was issued to the customerâ€™s repair shop and rental agency as per the approved settlement terms.
The claim file was officially closed following payment and confirmation that repairs were completed successfully.
All claim-related documentation and records were archived in compliance with company retention policies.
